fields.description: ID of the default record type for Account. For example, if specifying Administrative (the recommended Account model), enter the ID of the Administrative record type for the Account object.
fields.inlineHelpText: ID of the default record type for Account. For example, if specifying Administrative (the recommended Account model), enter the ID of the Administrative record type for the Account object.
fields.label: Account Processor

fields.description: The record types of Accounts that should have multi-addresses enabled.
fields.inlineHelpText: Record Types of those Accounts that should have multi-addresses enabled.
fields.label: Multi-Address Accounts

fields.description: The record types of Accounts to be automatically deleted if all their associated Contacts have been deleted.
fields.inlineHelpText: Record Types of those Accounts that should be deleted if all its children Contacts have been deleted.
fields.label: Accounts to Delete

fields.description: Stores the default format for Admin Account names.
fields.inlineHelpText: This is the setting for admin account naming format
fields.label: Admin Account Naming Format

fields.description: Stores other info about Admin Account naming format.
fields.inlineHelpText: To store other naming setting for admin account
fields.label: Admin Other Name Setting

fields.description: The Account record type used for Administrative Accounts. This setting affects management of Address records and the naming format of Administrative Accounts.
fields.inlineHelpText: The Account record type used for Administrative Accounts. This setting affects management of address records and the naming format of Administrative Accounts.
fields.label: Administrative Account Record Type

fields.description: The namespace of the Gift Entry Manager managed package.
fields.inlineHelpText: The namespace of the Gift Entry Management managed package.
fields.label: GEM Namespace

fields.description: If enabled, an error results when users populate a primary field on Contact with an Account that has a record type mismatch to the record type defined in EDA Settings. The Affiliation record is not created and primary fields on Contact are not corrected
fields.inlineHelpText: If checked, an error results when users populate a primary field on Contact with an Account that has a record type mismatch to the record type defined in EDA Settings. The Affiliation record is not created and primary fields on Contact are not corrected
fields.label: Affiliation Record Type Enforced

fields.description: Indicates whether to set the End Date of the Affiliation created with a Program Enrollment. If enabled, set the End Date to the Program Enrollment's End Date. If disabled, don't specify the Affiliation's End Date.
fields.inlineHelpText: Indicates whether to set the End Date of the Affiliation created with a Program Enrollment. If enabled, set the End Date to the Program Enrollment's End Date. If disabled, don't specify the Affiliation's End Date.
fields.label: Affil End Date Copy from Prog Enroll

fields.description: Indicates whether to set the Start Date of the Affiliation created with a Program Enrollment. If enabled, set the Start Date to the Program Enrollment's Start Date. If disabled, don't specify the Affiliation's Start Date.
fields.inlineHelpText: Indicates whether to set the Start Date of the Affiliation created with a Program Enrollment. If enabled, set the Start Date to the Program Enrollment's Start Date. If disabled, don't specify the Affiliation's Start Date.
fields.label: Affil Start Date Copy from Prog Enroll

fields.description: If the related setting, Affil Delete When Delete Prog Enroll, is disabled, this setting specifies the value to set for the Affiliation's Status, when its related Program Enrollment is deleted.
fields.inlineHelpText: If the related setting, Affil Delete When Delete Prog Enroll, is disabled, this setting specifies the value to set for the Affiliation's Status, when its related Program Enrollment is deleted.
fields.label: Affil Status When Delete Prog Enroll

fields.description: Indicates whether to delete an Affiliation when its related Program Enrollment is deleted. If enabled, delete the Affiliation. If disabled, set the Affiliation's Status to the value specified in the related setting, Affil Status When Delete Prog Enroll.
fields.inlineHelpText: Indicates whether to delete an Affiliation when its related Program Enrollment is deleted. If enabled, delete the Affiliation. If disabled, set the Affiliation's Status to the value specified in the related setting, Affil Status When Delete Prog Enroll.
fields.label: Affil Delete When Delete Prog Enroll

fields.description: If the related setting, Affil Set Role When Create Prog Enroll, is enabled, this setting specifies the value to set for the Role on the Affiliation created with a Program Enrollment.
fields.inlineHelpText: If the related setting, Affil Set Role When Create Prog Enroll, is enabled, this setting specifies the value to set for the Role on the Affiliation created with a Program Enrollment.
fields.label: Affil Role When Create Prog Enroll

fields.description: Indicates whether to specify a Role for the Affiliation created with a Program Enrollment. If enabled, set the Affiliation's Role to the value specified in the related setting, Affil Role When Create Prog Enroll. If disabled, don't specify a Role.
fields.inlineHelpText: Indicates whether to specify a Role for the Affiliation created with a Program Enrollment. If enabled, set the Affiliation's Role to the value specified in the related setting, Affil Role When Create Prog Enroll. If disabled, don't specify a Role.
fields.label: Affil Set Role When Create Prog Enroll

fields.description: The value set for the Status of an Affiliation record automatically created with a Program Enrollment.
fields.inlineHelpText: The Status value set on the Affiliation created with a Program Enrollment.
fields.label: Affil Status When Create Prog Enroll

fields.description: Auto-created Relationships are deduplicated to prevent duplication of Relationship records between Contacts. Select Allow Auto-Created Duplicate Relations to disable this behavior and allow multiple Relationships of the same type between two Contacts.
fields.inlineHelpText: Auto-created Relationships are auto-deduplicated to prevent duplicate Relationship records from being created between two Contacts.  Check this box to disable this behavior & allow multiple Relationships of the same Type to be created between two Contacts
fields.label: Allow Auto-Created Duplicate Relations

fields.description: The most recent execution date of the Async Job error logger.
fields.label: Async Error Check Last Run

fields.description: If enabled, the Household Name is automatically set based on the Household Name Format settings.
fields.inlineHelpText: If checked, the system will provide automatic naming for Household Names, Informal and Formal Greetings.
fields.label: Automatic Household Naming

fields.description: Enables multi-address functionality for Contacts.
fields.inlineHelpText: Address management support for Contacts.
fields.label: Address management support for Contacts.

fields.description: The Fluency value automatically set on newly created Contact Language records when users set the Primary Language lookup field on a Contact.
fields.inlineHelpText: The Fluency value automatically set on newly created Contact Language records when users set the Primary Language lookup field on a Contact.
fields.label: Default Contact Language Fluency

fields.description: If selected, the custom error handling framework is disabled.
fields.inlineHelpText: If checked, EDA's error handling framework is disabled.
fields.label: Disable Error Handling

fields.description: Disable the enforcement of the Preferred Email field for Contact.
fields.inlineHelpText: Select this box to disable the enforcement of the Preferred Email field for Contacts.
fields.label: Disable Preferred Email Enforcement

fields.description: Disable the enforcement of the Preferred Phone field for Contact.
fields.inlineHelpText: Select this box to disable the enforcement of the Preferred Phone field for Contacts.
fields.label: Disable Preferred Phone Enforcement

fields.description: When enabled, allows users to choose the Contact type (Faculty or Student) when creating a Course Connection record. This feature requires default Contact record types to be set for active students and faculty.
fields.label: Enable Course Connections

fields.description: Select to enable debug statements in managed package code.
fields.inlineHelpText: Turn this on to enable debug statements in managed package code.
fields.label: Enable Debug

fields.description: Turns on the Preferred Phone functionality that was released in EDA 1.82. This functionality syncs the Preferred Phone field to the Contact's standard Phone field and validates that the value in Preferred Phone exists and has a value.
fields.inlineHelpText: Sync the Preferred Phone field to the Contact's standard Phone field and validate that the value in Preferred Phone exists and has a value.
fields.label: Enable New Preferred Phone Sync

fields.description: If selected, notifications are posted for package-generated errors.
fields.inlineHelpText: Check this if you'd like the system to post notifications for certain type of errors.
fields.label: Error Notifications

fields.description: Stores the type of user to send error notifications to.
fields.inlineHelpText: Select the type of user to send notifications to.
fields.label: Error Notification Recipients

fields.description: The default Contact record type for Faculty when creating a Course Connection record.
fields.label: Faculty Record Type

fields.description: Stores the Household Account Naming Format.

fields.label: Household Account Naming Format

fields.description: Determines the method used to generate the reciprocal relationship. Use List Setting to use custom settings by gender. Use Value Inversion to invert the type if appropriate ("Parent-Child" to "Child-Parent")
fields.inlineHelpText: Determines method used to generate the reciprocal relationship.  Either List Setting which uses custom settings by gender, or Value Inversion, which inverts the type if appropriate ("Parent-Child" to "Child-Parent")
fields.label: Reciprocal Method

fields.description: When enabled, changes to single address fields on Contact or Account are treated as updates to the existing address (for example, no new Address object is created). White space and case changes are treated as updates.
fields.inlineHelpText: If checked, changes to a single Contact or Account address field update the existing Address, rather than creating a new Address.
fields.label: Simple Address Change Treated as Update

fields.description: Enable this feature to store errors.
fields.inlineHelpText: Check this if you'd like errors to be stored in the database.
fields.label: Store Errors

fields.description: The default record type when creating Course Connections for active students.
fields.label: Student Record Type

fields.description: When selected, Plan Requirements can specify either a Program Plan or a parent Plan Requirement, but not both. For example, a Plan Requirement that has a parent Plan Requirement canâ€™t also specify a Program Plan, or vice versa. If you specify both a Program Plan and a parent Plan Requirement, an error message prevents saving until only one is selected.
fields.inlineHelpText: When selected, Plan Requirements can specify either a Program Plan or a parent Plan Requirement, but not both. If you specify both a Program Plan and a parent Plan Requirement, an error message will prevent you from saving until only one is selected.
fields.label: Validate Program Plan for Nested PR
